 I. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָרַר‎</span> **verb** ==be bitter== (Late Hebrew ***id.***; Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***marâru***</u></abbr> and derivatives [[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>HWB 427</sup>; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***become roused*** (of bile), II. ***make bitter***, IV. ***become bitter***; <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***bitter***; Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; Aramaic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְרַר‎</span>); — 

**Qal** ***Perfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַר‎</span> [[Isa.38.17|Isa 38:17]] + 2 t.; 3 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָ֫רָה‎</span> [[1Sam.30.6|1Sam 30:6]]; [[2Kgs.4.27|2Kgs 4:27]] ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יֵמַר‎</span> [[Isa.24.9|Isa 24:9]] — ***be bitter:*** 

**1.** literal <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יֵמַר שֵׁכָר לְשֹׁתָיו‎</span> [[Isa.24.9|Isa 24:9]]. 

**2.** figurative <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָ֫רָה נֶפֶשׁ‎</span> [[1Sam.30.6|1Sam 30:6]] ***the soul*** of all the people ***was bitter*** against (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַלֿ‎</span>); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נַפְשָׁהּ מָ֫רָהלָֿהּ‎</span> [[2Kgs.4.27|2Kgs 4:27]] ***her soul, it is bitter to her*** (i.e. she is in bitter distress); impersonal <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַרלִֿי מְאֹד מִכֶּם‎</span> [[Ruth.1.13|Ruth 1:13]] ***it is very bitter to me on your account*** (I am much distressed), compare [[Lam.1.4|Lam 1:4]]. — <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְשָׁלוֺם מַרלִֿי מָ֑ר‎</span> [[Isa.38.17|Isa 38:17]] is dubious; [[BDB#Che|Che]]<sup>Comm.</sup> ***for*** (***my***) ***welfare was it*** (***so***) ***bitter to me***, (***so***) ***bitter***, compare [[BDB#Brd|Brd]]; so [[BDB#De|De]] [[BDB#Kau|Kau]] (treating <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מר‎</span> apparently as adjective ); &lt; Drechsl. [[BDB#Di|Di]] ***for my welfare did the bitter become bitter to me*** (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָ֑ר‎</span> adjective); [[BDB#Lo|Lo]] [[BDB#Gr|Gr]], compare [[BDB#Buhl|Buhl]] (sub <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַר‎</span> adjective ), read <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָר‎</span> for <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַר‎</span> (√ <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מור‎</span>), the bitter ***is changed*** for me into welfare; [[BDB#Che|Che]]<sup>Hpt strike out</sup> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָ֑ר‎</span>; [[BDB#Du|Du]] (after [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]]) strike out clause as gloss. **Pi\`el** ***Imperfect*** 1 singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֲמָרֵר‎</span> [[Isa.22.4|Isa 22:4]] 3 masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיְמָֽרֲרוּ‎</span> [[Exod.1.14|Exod 1:14]], suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיְמָֽרֲרֻהוּ‎</span> [[Gen.49.23|Gen 49:23]] — ***make bitter, shew bitterness:*** — 

**1.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיְמ‎</span> [[Gen.49.23|Gen 49:23]] (poem) and the archers ***shewed bitterness*** (i.e. bitter hostility) ***toward him*** (suffix of indirect object); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֲמָרֵר בַּבֶּכִ֑י‎</span> [[Isa.22.4|Isa 22:4]] ***I will shew bitterness in weeping*** (= weep bitterly). 

**2.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶתחַֿיֵּיהֶם‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיְמ‎</span> [[Exod.1.14|Exod 1:14]] ([[BDB#P|P]]) ***and they made their lives bitter*** by slavery. **Hiph\`il** ***Perfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֵמַר‎</span> [[Ruth.1.20|Ruth 1:20]]; [[Job.27.2|Job 27:2]] ***Imperfect*** 2 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תַּמֵּר‎</span> [[Exod.23.21|Exod 23:21]] (but read <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תֶּ֫מֶר‎</span> √ <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מרה‎</span> **Hiph\`il** q. v.); ***Infinitive absolute*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הָמֵר‎</span> [[Zech.12.10|Zech 12:10]] (twice in verse); — ***make bitter, shew bitterness:*** 

**1.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שַׁדַּי הֵמַר נַפְשִׁי‎</span> [[Job.27.2|Job 27:2]] ***Shadday, who hath embittered my soul***; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֵמַר שַׁדַּי לִי מְאֹד‎</span> [[Ruth.1.20|Ruth 1:20]]. 

**2.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְהָמֵר עָלָיו כְּהָמֵר עַלהַֿבְּכוֺר‎</span> [[Zech.12.10|Zech 12:10]] ***and a bitter outcry*** (= literally shewing bitterness; \|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִסְפֵּד‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סָפַד‎</span>) over him, like a ***bitter outcry*** over the first-born. **Hithpalpel** ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְיִתְמַרְמַר‎</span> [[Dan.11.11|Dan 11:11]] ***and*** the king of the south ***shall embitter himself*** (be enraged); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶלֿ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיִּתְמ‎</span> [[Dan.8.7|Dan 8:7]] ***and he was enraged against***.
